title.et: Tänapäeva inglise ja ameerika kirjandus ja filmid

title.en: History of English and American Literature

description.en: The course provides an overview of contemporary English and American literature and its screening (subject also includes minority literature and its impact).
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate tänapäevasest inglise ja ameerika kirjandusest ja selle ekraniseeringust (aine hõlmab ka vähemusrahvuste kirjandust ja selle mõju).

objectives.en: To give an overview of contemporary English and American literature and its screening.
objectives.et: Anda ülevaade tänapäeva inglise ja ameerika kirjandusest ja  selle ekraniseeringust.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) is aware of the main themes and directions of contemporary English and American literature, authors and their works;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) on teadlik tänapäeva inglise keele ja ameerika kirjanduse põhisuundadest, autoritest ja nende teostest;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) is able to analyze contemporary English and American literary works and films based on them, taking into account the peculiarities of the genre and the author.
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on võimeline analüüsima tänapäeva inglise ja ameerika kirjanduse teoseid ja nendel põhinevaid filme arvestades žanri ja autori eripärasusi.

independent_work.et: "Contemporary British and American Literature" (N.Raud): independent reading and analysis of the recommended texts (fiction +drama +poetry )

description.et:
A- Exam questions are answered with maximum precision and reference to corresponding theoretical sources and are supported by references to the sample text; the answer demonstrates a very high level of independent and creative thinking and contributes to well-known interpretations of the text.
B- Exam questions are answered correctly and demonstrate very good knowledge of theoretical aspects and reference to the sample text; the answers reveal the ability of critical thinking and creativity at a very good level; it shows the knowledge of literary critics' opinions of the text.
C- Exam questions are answered with various degrees of precision and demonstrate good knowledge of theoretical aspects and are supported by references to the sample text; the answers reveal partial readiness of the student to analyse a piece of literature critically; the analysis shows good level of independent thinking.
D- Answers to exam questions show the student's satisfactory knowledge of some theoretical aspects and do not have any support by example from the sample text; there are some references to other critics' opinions; the answers demonstrate satisfactory level of independent thinking and creativity;
E- Exam answers demonstrate student's knowledge of some basic principles of literary analysis and his/her ability to apply them while analysisng a piece of literature in a conventional way; the analysis demonstrates a poor level of independent thinking and creativity.

grade_preconditions.et:
The course consists of 2 parts "Contemporary British and American Literature" (N.Raud) and "Contemporary British and American Films"(A.Golubeva) - the completion of each part of the course gives max 50% of the course completion grade. 
"Contemporary  British and American Literature" (N.Raud): final assessment includes home work assignments' completion (forum tasks 1-6) (100%), Moodle literature analysis papers submission (assignments 1-3) (100%), and a final examination paper submitted in writing: the paper consists of 2 parts (American and British contemporary literature) with 3 questions in each (prose+poetry+drama).

debt_elimination.et: 2 weeks to account for each missed test

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
"Contemporary British and American Literature" (N.Raud): 
1.Ronald Carter and John McRae 2001.The Penguin Guide to Literature in English. Penguin.
2.Oxford Anthology of English Literature -(ed.Kermode F., Hollander J) 1973.- New York: OUP
3.Gower R. 1990 Past into Present , An Anthology of British and American Literature England : Longman
resources.recommended_materials:
"Contemporary British and American Literature" (N.Raud): 
1.G.C. Thornley and Gwyneth Roberts.1994. An Outline of English Literature.-Longman
2.Ronald Carter and John McRae. 2001. The Routledge History of Literature in English. London and New York. Routledge
3.The Readers Companion to Twentieth Century Writers ( ed. Parker P.) 1995. Oxford: Helicon.
4.The Penguin History of Literature. The Twentieth Century ( ed. Dodsworth M.) 1994. London: Penguin Books.
